titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the University of Pittsburgh Archives Audio Recordings Collection, 1950-2000 UA.Audio
titlestmt.author: Patrick Trembeth.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-12-13 15:51:41 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: University of Pittsburgh Archives Audio Recordings Collection

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: University of Pittsburgh. Archives Service Center

did.abstract: A collection of audio recordings pertaining to the University of Pittsburgh and its history dating from ca. 1950 to 2005.
did.physloc: Thomas Boulevard, Room 211, UA Stacks, Range 17/6/1-6

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The collection contains open reel tape and standard audiocassettes. An open reel player and cassette player are required to access content which the Archives Service Center can provide.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: University of Pittsburgh Archives Audio Recordings, 1950-2005, UA.Audio, University Archives, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: University of Pittsburgh Archives Audio Recordings, 1950-2005, UA.Audio, University Archives, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was arranged and entered into Archivists' Toolkit by Patrick Lembeth in Summer 2011.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection of audio recordings are arranged into the following nine series:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection contains audio recordings pertaining to the University of Pittsburgh and its history dating from ca. 1950 to 2005. Content available includes Commencement proceedings, interviews with University chancellors, lectures, and student life. The dominant media types are open reel tapes and standard audiocassettes.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was acquired over a period of years from deposits by University Offices.

did.unittitle: University Events

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains audio items focused on University-sponsored events, such as commencements, convocations, facility groundbreakings, guest lecturers and memorial events from throughout the second half of the twentieth century.

did.unittitle: Commencements

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains 19 audio recordings of commencement proceedings and speeches from 1959-1994. Highlights include speeches given by former Representative F. Bradford Morse and Edward A. Weeks, editor of The Atlantic Monthly.

did.unittitle: University Lectures

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains 23 audio recordings of University-sponsored lectures from 1950-1989. Contained within are mainly lectures given by visiting researchers and academics. Highlights of this subseries include a lecture by Louis Farrakhan as well as a lecture series on brainwashing during the Korean War.

Convocations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains 14 audio recordings of University convocation proceedings spanning the years 1958-1989. Highlights of the subseries include speeches given by former Supreme Court Chief Justice Earl Warren and Pulitzer Prize winning Librarian of Congress, Archibald MacLeish.

did.unittitle: Dedications/Groundbreakings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains 16 audio recordings of dedications or groundbreakings of the University of Pittsburgh's landmarks and facilities from 1956-1992. Highlights include groundbreaking ceremonies for the Law School as well as the dedication of notable buildings, such as the Cathedral of Learning.

did.unittitle: Memorial Events

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains 14 audio recordings of memorial events dedicated to members of the University of Pittsburgh faculty or important figures within the City of Pittsburgh from 1974-1992. Notable entries include the Samuel Lazerow Memorial Lecture series and the Heinz Chapel 50th Anniversary.

did.unittitle: University History

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains audio recordings pertaining to documenting the history of the University of Pittsburgh from 1958-1981. Highlights of this subseries include oral histories of the School of Information Sciences, the School of Social Work, and the R. Alberts University History Interviews.

Administration

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains audio recordings that focus on the administration and functions of the University of Pittsburgh faculty and staff from 1950-2000. Included in this series are various staff meetings, faculty speeches, and planning committees' meetings pertaining to the administration of the University. Highlights of the series include speeches by both University Chancellors Edward Litchfield and Wesley Posvar.

did.unittitle: Staff Meetings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains 35 audio recordings of staff meetings at the University of Pittsburgh from 1956-1997. Included are faculty orientations, advisory committees, and Deans' meetings at Pitt and its branch campuses. Highlights include Chancellor Edward H. Litchfield's first speech to the faculty.

Speeches/Lectures

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains 19 audio recordings of speeches given by faculty members at the University of Pittsburgh from 1957-1978. Most items are speeches given to third party businesses or events, highlighted by speeches given by Chancellor Wesley Posvar to the Allegheny County Ministerial Union and a speech by Posvar to the student body.

did.unittitle: Joint Planning Seminars

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains 14 audio recordings of joint planning seminars at the University of Pittsburgh from 1958-1977. These items focus on the future planning of Pitt's goals moving into a modernized and urban future. Highlights include seminars discussing urban planning and the development of the urban environment.

did.unittitle: Student Life

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains audio recordings focused on detailing student life and events at the University of Pittsburgh from 1950-2000. Included within this series are student meetings, student centered events, and arts/entertainment conducted by students of the University. Notable highlights include numerous concert performances by the Heinz Chapel Choir.

did.unittitle: Student Meetings/Administration

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains five audio recordings of student and student government meetings at the University of Pittsburgh from 1958-1959. Notable items in this subseries include discussion about implementing a trimester school plan, and the discussion around the principles of administration at Pitt.

did.unittitle: Special Student Meeting - Dr. James Robinson
Student Advisory Council - Discussion of Proposed Trimester Plan
Special Student Meeting - Dr. Leland Burrows
Special Student Meeting - "Some Further Principles of Public Administration" - Donald C. Stone
Special Student Meeting - "Principles of Public Administration - Donald C. Stone
Student Events

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains seven audio recordings of student sponsored events at the University of Pittsburgh from 1970-1977. Notable entries in this subseries include a mass meeting of students in the Commons Room as well as addresses from the chancellor to parents and students during parents' weekend.

Concerts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains 25 audio recordings of arts and entertainment events organized and performed by University of Pittsburgh students from 1954-1997. Most notably, this subseries contains numerous editions of concerts performed by the Heinz Chapel Choir during the 1990s.

did.unittitle: Media Events

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains audio recordings of media events involving the University of Pittsburgh from 1950-2000. It comprises interviews, television programs, and radio programs which were focused on the University and its endeavors. Notable entries include WTAE and KDKA interviews with Chancellor Posvar.

did.unittitle: Interviews

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains ten audio recordings of interviews with Pitt faculty and staff. Spanning across Radio and Television, these interviews focus on the current events both internationally and in Pittsburgh. Notable interviews include a KDKA interview with Chancellor Posvar discussing financial problems in Pittsburgh.

did.unittitle: An Interview with Leopold Stowkoski - Conducted by Harvey Pope
Professor John Dewey 90th Birthday Interview - Conducted by Richard Hope

TV Programs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains ten audio recordings focused on TV programs regarding the University of Pittsburgh and its dealings mainly in the City of Pittsburgh from 1958-1977. Notable entries include a series of programs conducted by the GSPIA, hosted by Eleanor Roosevelt, discussing the development of the world economy during the 1960's.

International Events

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains audio recordings of international events which occurred at the University of Pittsburgh from 1950-2000. Highlights of this subseries include a luncheon visit with former Soviet leader Nikita Khrushchev as well as a meeting with business delegates from China, hosted by Chancellor Posvar.
